poem:
Title: "Echo in Kingston"

Bob Marley, 
in winter's grasp, sans shoes, 
sings to the bitten breeze, 
Smile Jamaica -

A paean of plucked chords
against the carpet of Kingston,
a song broadcast across breadfruit
and banana peels,

It knits the air,
this anthem, this heartbeat
sung to me on borrowed shores,
a farewell woven from island symphony.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Firebrand, poet and heart-throb’: how the film One Love captures the truth about Bob Marley Harry J’s studio, Kingston, Jamaica, winter 1976. Wearing a Spartan Health Club T-shirt and busted sandals, Bob Marley finishes singing a take of a weirdly cheery song called Smile Jamaica. I had been reporting from the island for the British rock press and was popping by to give my farewells – only to be surprised by this ditty that sounded". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘Firebrand, poet and heart-throb’: how the film One Love captures the truth about Bob Marley Harry J’s studio, Kingston, Jamaica, winter 1976.
